Disbandment of Treacherous Party Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Disbandment of Treacherous Party Urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The Reunification Solidarity in south Korea released a statement titled "Disband the Grand National Party, a treacherous and vulgar party" on February 24.
 The statement recalled that gentries of the GNP let loose a string of reckless remarks slandering the June 15 joint declaration and undisguisedly criticized the south-north reconciliation and cooperation.    
 The GNP clan took issue with any work for the implementation of the joint declaration because it does not want the reunification of the nation, the statement pointed out.
 It demanded the GNP drop its sinister attempts to block the reunification movement of the nation and disband itself at once.

Greetings to Ghanaian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Ghanaian President 
    Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Mar. 2 sent a message of greetings to Ghanaian President John Agyekum Kufuor on the occasion of the 49th anniversary of the independence of Ghana.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples, the message wholeheartedly wished the Ghanaian president success in his responsible work for the development of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Construction Site of Samsu Power Station
Kim Jong Il's Works Studied in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Studied in Different Countries 
    Pyongyang, March 4 (KCNA) -- A seminar, a lecture and a reading session on leader Kim Jong Il's famous works "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" and "Songun Politics of Our Party Is an Effective Socialist Political Mode" were held by the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea, the Mongolian Chinggis Khan College and Marien Ngouabi University of Congo in the period from Feb. 7 to 15 on the occasion of the February holiday.
 Displayed in the venues of the functions were photos showing the leader's historical unofficial visit to China and his Songun revolutionary leadership exploits.
 Banou Keita, director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea, said at a seminar that Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" serves as an encyclopedia indicating the road to be followed by the times and the revolution.
 N. Bold, chairman of the Centre for the Study of the Juche Idea of the Mongolian Chinggis Khan College, said at a lecture that   Kim Jong Il has wisely led the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation with his Songun politics, an embodiment of the Songun idea based on the Juche idea.    
 The DPRK has protected the sovereignty of the country and dynamically advanced along the path chosen by itself despite the U.S. imperialists' moves to isolate and stifle it, he noted, ascribing this to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
 The participants of the functions watched Korean films "They Were Always Together on the Road to Bring about the People's Well-being", "Great Leadership over the Drive to Successfully Build a Great Prosperous Powerful Nation" and "Feb. 16, the Nation's Greatest Holiday."

articles.title: Sri Lankan President Supports Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Sri Lankan President Supports Korea's Reunification 
    Pyongyang, March 4 (KCNA) -- I hope Korea will be reunified as early as possible in the spirit of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration. Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapakse said this when receiving credentials from the DPRK ambassador e.p. to Sri Lanka on Feb. 28. We pleased with the shining successes made by the DPRK in all fields including politics, economy and culture, he added.
 Pointing to the good friendly relations that exist between the two countries, he expressed the hope that those ties would grow stronger in the future.
